text: {{Infobox writer |name = Hayford Peirce |pseudonym = |birth_date = |birth_place = Bangor, Maine, U.S. |death_date = |death_place = Tucson, Arizona, U.S. |occupation = Writer |genre = Science fiction Mysteries Spy thrillers |movement = |influences = |influenced = |website = |signature = }} Hayford Peirce (January 7, 1942 â€“ November 19, 2020) was an American writer of science fiction, mysteries, and spy thrillers. He wrote many short stories for the science-fiction magazines Analog, Galaxy, and Omni. He also wrote mystery short stories for Alfred Hitchcock's Mystery Magazine and Ellery Queen's Mystery Magazine. Peirce shot himself in the head on November 19, 2020 in Tucson, Arizona after shooting his wife. Peirce was hospitalized and died a few hours later, aged 78. ==References== Category:1942 births Category:2020 deaths Category:American novelists Category:Writers from Bangor, Maine Category:Suicides by firearm in the United States
